Description: East Greek pottery amphora with a handle on either side of the narrow neck, a pronounced shoulder and wide body which tapers to a narrow, flat base. At the top of the neck is an external rim, the level of which is irregular and part of which is missing. The foot has been broken off and repaired, leaving a hole in the side. The fabric exhibits a black core and grey surface and contains inclusions of limestone and mica.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 50, domestic buildings in the urban area to the east of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp").
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 50 has been scratched into the shoulder.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.113, p.204, pl.46)
